folder: Herald Square & Broadway & 34th Street (North)., Manhattan, NY
text:
Broadway, north from 34th Street. R. H. Macy and Company, a large department store, is shown at the right. Above it, in the distance, is the Metropolitan Opera House, the New York Times Building, and the Hotel Astor.
In the centre, the former Seventy-First Regiment Armory and Herald Building has been cut in half; and the northern half demolished. On the site of the latter has risen the Herald Square Building, which the southern half is occupied by Rogers Peet & Company.
About 1930.

Ewing Galloway.
title: Manhattan: Herald Square - Broadway - 34th Street (North).

text:
Herald Square, Manhattan

Federal Art Project
"Changing New York"
Berenice Abbott, photographer

[Note: negative at Museum of the City of New York]
Code III B-1

p. 130, Changing New York
title: Manhattan: Herald Square - 34th Street (West).

folder: Herald Square & [William Earl Dodge statue.], Manhattan, NY
text:
Herald Square: The William Earl Dodge statue prior to removal to Bryant Park. This is to be replaced with Minerva and the Bell Ringers that previously were mounted on the former Herald Building. View 2 shows this feature under construction.

1: July 8, 1940
2: Sept. 27, 1940

George D. Chinn

P. L. Sperr
title: Manhattan: Herald Square - [William Earl Dodge statue.]
